intro: Sebaea scabra, commonly known as the rough sebaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often as a shrub or subshrub. The plant's unique morphology and adaptability to harsh conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
